page.title: 15THE TWO WOOTTON PARISHES.
page.content: { Mr Rayner}is the rector of the two parishes in{Wootton,St.Marks and St. {Edmonds.}St.Marks has a congregation of 110-120 but St. Edmonds,the smaller of the two only has a congregation of 25-30.Originally St.Edmonds was built for the owners of a Manor House and their staff.St.Edmonds was built in 1087 and will be celebrating its 900 aniversary in two years time.The church seats 48 and is the only church on the Island which still retains its original walls. There are approximately six services during the week between the two churches but every morning Mr Rayner goes to St.Marks to say morning prayer and in the evening he goes to St.Edmonds for evening song. Mr Rayner is involved in the village choral society,the marksman club for middle school children and he also
